question.text: Co-dominance is seen in the person who has a blood group

solution.text: Co-dominance is the phenomenon is which both the alleles present in an organism express equally. Allele  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></mrow></msup></math>  produces blood group antigen A while Allele  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow></msup></math>  produces blood group antigen B. When a person has genotype  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow></msup></math>  both these genes are equally expressed and the body produces both antigens A and B. Such a person is said to have blood group AB
